description: My, you should see the look on your face. Do my darkened wings fascinate you? They're what you get when you trade a diet of pure morning dew for a feast of blood. But there's no need to pity me—I chose the path I did to become stronger, after all.
evo_description: Every now and then a young fairy comes to me for help. Ah, they remind me of the old me. All I do is give their pristine wings a little nudge in the right direction. Once they develop a taste for blood, they never go back.

description: Bwahahaha! Sucks to be you, reapers—you're way too late! You think you can just saunter up with your dull blades and collect a soul after its host has died? Psh, anyone with any sense knows that the best souls are ones you harvest fresh.
evo_description: Just as flesh rots and bones turn to dust, souls have a freshness factor. They're like fruits; you've got to pluck them the instant they ripen. Well, it's been nice talking to you, but I've got some souls to devour. Why don't you sharpen your scythe and try again, reaper?

skill_disc: Fanfare: Draw a card.

evo_description: Just as flesh rots and bones turn to dust, souls have a freshness factor. You've gotta pluck them the instant they ripen, but reapers just don't get that. Anyway, been nice talking, but I've gotta bounce. Feel free to reap my leftovers, though.

All conflicts and wars are the product of discrepant views and insufficient empathy. Mix, intermingle, ravish, enrapture, and save this world. —Teachings from the Manor of Lust

evo_description: The world teems with depravity and chaos, yet still a glimmer of hope shines. Though no hero rides forth to save the day, though cries for mercy go unheard, a small breeze abides. And when it stirs, howling winds will sweep away the dark clouds and usher in the light.
